fields.description:
The latest update to SourceTree 1.8 is a huge disappointment. Aside from the missing colors in the toolbar icons already mentioned in two other tickets (SRCTREEWIN-4273 and SRCTREEWIN-4278) the repository list to the left side is extremely narrow now and thus barely usable.

It's also missing icons & colors which made it very easy to see states in the previous version.

For now I've downloaded [version 1.6.0|https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTreeSetup_1.6.0.exe] and performed all updates within 1.6.x to get back a usable version.
fields.summary: Repository list extremely narrow, missing icons/colors

fields.description:
Updated to version 1.8.1 and noticed that the Diff Viewer keeps showing the changes of the last selected staged file, even when I select an unstaged file.

When I select any unstaged file the Diff Viewer refreshes to the last selected staged file.

It's really annoying because I can't see what was changed in order to decide what I want to stage.
fields.summary: Diff Viewer doesn't work for unstage files.

fields.description:
Dear Attlasian,
Please rollback recent UI change to Source Tree. It's terrible and unusable.
Monochrome icons in toolbar probably looks good only in particular Windows theme, but not in default Windows theme. 
Your designers may persuade that flat design is cool, but usability of the program was GREATLY decreased.
Thankfully you left branch and commits tree without visible changes. They are colorful and help you, the other part of the UI is spiritless and does not help. 
I understand that you may have different opinion, but just try to use SourceTree on everyday job and you will see that new UI and icons are terrible. They may look naturally on Android, but not on Windows.
By the way, branch list looks very similar to Outlook 2013/2016 folders list. Same no visual vertical distinction between items, just text items, it is terrible.
New icons for file states: M doesn't have enough difference from ?. I should spent time and look more carefully what was changed.
P.S. You issue tracker freeze my browser around 6 times while I fill in this issue. Scripts on the page should not freeze. Scenario: https://jira.atlassian.com/s/2…ael.disabled=true&locale=en-UK:125
P.S2. Your tracker does not find SourceTree version 1.8.1.0
fields.summary: New icons are awful

{panel}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch origin

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false pull origin dev

fields.description:
I just updated SourceTree to 1.8 and 'git flow' commands does not work anymore.
I tried first with Git 1.9.5 32-bit which was working in SourceTree 1.7 and then I upgraded to the last version 2.7.1 64-bit but got the same result.
For both version git flow works properly from the command line but not from SourceTree.

See the attached image for the error when creating a new feature.

fields.description: The new interface buttons don't have any color. Color is important for the interface as it helps the eye find the button you're looking for. It's harder even if the button's position didn't change after the update.

Any tab characters which show in the file diff view are rendering as visible characters, overlayed on top of other text.

Worse (and more bizarrely) a tab at the end of the last line of the file causes the diff view to completely hide that line. See screenshot (there is a tab character after the word "after").

fields.description: Our team uses this button frequently and we would love to see it back in the toolbar and not only accessible from the "File"-menu.
fields.summary: Git Flow button missing in toolbar

fields.description:
After installing both 1.8.0 and 1.8.1 git flow is not working. Creating or finishing features, releases or hotfixes is not working. 

The dialog shows no errors: http://prntscr.com/a3yvj0
fields.summary: After installing 1.8.1 git flow is not working

fields.description:
After an update to 1.8.1 bevels disappeared and it looks like some elements did not load correctly:
- tabs - inconsitent with the whole UI - they're flat, but list of commits is using nice 3d elements
- textboxes - flat, but comboboxes use nice UI
- the line between stashes and commit list/info - the text looks just bad if it is long enough - in previous versions there was a line clearly indicating the boundaries
- icons in the toolbar miss colors and are harder to distinguish - they're too subtle
fields.summary: UI is broken

fields.description:
I can't stage/commit some local deleted file in 1.8.
Tried ticking "Unstaged files" or drag&drop
Endless loading icon
fields.summary: Can't stage a deleted file

Hi,
please take a look at below screenshots.
I've just updated SourceTree to 1.8.0 and it says "no new updates" which is not true because right now there is 1.8.1 available.

When committing or pushing the view always changes from "Log / History" to "File Status".. So i need always to click to "Log / History" on the bottom tabs..
Can i somewhere set the standard view??

After renaming a file, SourceTree is unable to commit the 'deleted' file. 

Exception shown: 

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- FileName.java
fatal: pathspec 'FileName.java' did not match any files

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: SourceTree cannot handle file rename
App crash every time when I try to push changes into stash repo

fields.description: The installer cannot find the installed version of Mercurial even though the PATH variable si set correctly. Furthermore, the option for pointing the installer to the already installed version does not work. The only way to complete the installation is to choose the embedded version of hg.
fields.summary: Installer cannot find existing Mercurial

fields.description:
Right clicking on a repo in the bookmarks panel then running a custom action crashes the entire application. Although running it from the "Actions" menu in the menu bar doesn't cause a crash.

Attached is the diagnostics file.
fields.summary: Crash when executing a custom action from the right click menu from the bookmarks panel

fields.description:
In the old UI, local branches had a blue arrow icon inside the log view. Because of the icon of remote branches were different, it was pretty easy to see, where branches are located. In the new UI, local and remote branches have the same icon. this makes it harder to detect, if a branch is local or remote.

My recommendation:

Change the remote icon. Maybe use the cloud icon from the repository tree?
fields.summary: Change the logo of remote branches in log view

fields.description: Sourcetree crash very often doing push/pull action on orign
fields.summary: Crash on push

fields.description:
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- account.php
fatal: pathspec 'account.php' did not match any files
fields.summary: Error add deleted file to commit

fields.description:
Hello,

All the time that you're in other tab than File Status, all the clicks that you make, change, push or every kind of action, after finish it automatically changes you to File Status. All the time, which is annoying.

I'll really appreciate that the last behavior of maintain you where you're came back again.

Thanks you for your time.
Best Regards.
fields.summary: File Status selected constantly

fields.description: After some actions (e.g. changing the branch) File Status tab turns itself active even if I have other tab active
fields.summary: File status tab randomly turns itself active

fields.description:
I'm trying to add a modified file to the staged area by clicking on the checkbox from the Unstaged area but Sourcetree crash.

The log produced by Sourcetree is attached to this issue.
fields.summary: Crash adding file to Staged files

fields.description:
When viewing file changes (e.g. in Log/History tab), the scrollbars aren't pretty usable. Right now, on files with long lines, i need to scroll to the right to see the commit/ discard button. On big changes i also need to scroll back to the top to see this button.

My recommendation:
Attach the scrollbars (atleast the horizontal one) to the hunk/file view and make a header with filename an the button which uses 100% of the space of the preview window. If multiple files are shown, add a second scrollbar on the outer container.
fields.summary: Change scrollbars in filepreview window

Source tree client kicks in just after update, tries to load the folder with the git repo, and crash.

Then if I try to load a "folder" with an active git repo in it, it crashed again.

fields.description:
After updating to the latest version of SourcTree, Git flow stopped working. I am unable to finish a hotfix. I have not tried any of the other Git flow options.

I had to revert to an older version of SourceTree.

Also, why was Git flow removed from the taskbar?

fields.description:
In the side menu of each unstaged file, there are two options for 'stage file' and none for 'discard file'. 
I clicked on discard hunk instead, but it does not refresh the file status. When I click in Refresh, it does nothing.
fields.summary: 'Stage file' appears twice in context menu

fields.description:
Diff viewer doesn't show all pending changes. Not even when refreshing through F5.
Switching between embedded and system Git also makes no difference.

See  !image-2016-02-16-11-22-30-901.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Diff viewer doesn't show all changes

fields.description: After upgrading, Sourcetree crashes whenever I click on a file to stage it.
fields.summary: Crash while staging a file

fields.description:
1. Tabs have on both sides unnecessary free space. Even if many tabs are open or window size is reduced the waste of space isn't reduced.
2. It isn't possible do re-sort tabs by drag and drop. Try to pull a tab to a different location - it isn't possible.
fields.summary: Tabs are too big and can't be sorted by drag and drop

fields.description:
In the diff window, the "Stage" & "Discard hunk" buttons are aligned to the right end of the code blocks. On small screen they are hidden outside the viewable area of the panel. You have to scroll right to reach them. 

In previous versions those buttons are allways visible and you can scroll to the right to see the rest of the code but the buttons are kept in view.

The buttons should be anchored to the panel visible area and not to the right edge of the code block (since the code block can be wider then the panel visible area)
fields.summary: "Stage" & "Discard hunk" buttons hidden to the right in small screens

fields.description: I just upgraded SourceTree to 1.8.0. It changed icon, asked many questions like I was install it for the first time. Then launched and crashed.
fields.summary: Crash after update to 1.8.0

fields.description:
App crashed when clicking on a tick box to move from unstaged to staged.

 !crash.png|thumbnail! 

Logs attached. Analytics seems not to work as well :)

I then tried to unstage the change and the application crashes every time.
